data.raw_content:
Sarah Chen: Good morning everyone. Thanks for joining this Q1 planning session. I wanted to start by reviewing our goals from last quarter.

Mike Rodriguez: Thanks Sarah. I think we made good progress on the customer acquisition front. We hit 85% of our target.

Sarah Chen: That's great to hear. What about the product roadmap? Where do we stand on the new dashboard features?

Mike Rodriguez: The dashboard redesign is about 60% complete. We ran into some technical debt issues that slowed us down. Brian's team has been working through those.

Brian Walsh: Yeah, we found some legacy code in the authentication module that needed refactoring. It pushed our timeline back by about two weeks, but we're back on track now.

Sarah Chen: Good. What's the revised ETA for the dashboard launch?

Brian Walsh: We're targeting end of February now. The core functionality is done, we're mostly doing polish and edge case testing.

Mike Rodriguez: From a business perspective, I think we should discuss the pricing changes. The competitors have been aggressive lately.

Sarah Chen: Agreed. Let's schedule a separate session for pricing strategy. I want to bring in Lisa from finance for that discussion.

Brian Walsh: One more thing - we should talk about the API deprecation timeline. Some of our enterprise customers are still on v1.

Sarah Chen: Good point. What's our plan for migration support?

Brian Walsh: We've drafted a migration guide and we're planning office hours for enterprise customers. Should take about 6 weeks to get everyone moved over.

Mike Rodriguez: I can have the customer success team reach out proactively. Better to get ahead of it than have people surprised.

Sarah Chen: Perfect. Let's sync up next week to review progress. Thanks everyone.
